definition: Chinese national culture/studies of ancient Chinese civilization/the Imperial College (history)

sentences.english: Mr. Meng Wentong is an unmatched master of Sinology in 20th Century China.

sentences.english: In which, it's not as easy as the so called "popularity of Sinology" can explain it.
sentences.chinese: 这其中，绝非是所谓的国学热这么简单可以解释的。

sentences.english: Today, the sinology flower is blooming in Yuancheng Foreign Language School.
sentences.chinese: 今天，国学这支奇葩正在校园绽放奇光异彩。

sentences.english: Cultural consciousnesses among all Chinese people determine the practice of Chinese Traditional Learning.
sentences.chinese: 而实践国学思想，有赖于全民的文化自觉。

sentences.english: Kogaku and Kokugaku are two different schools of thought in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 古学与国学是两个不同的学派。

sentences.english: Yang Shuda was a famous great master of National Essence Arts in modern times of China.
sentences.chinese: 杨树达是我国近现代著名的国学大师。

sentences.english: Chen Yinque, master of ancient Chinese civilization, is the case in his late years.
sentences.chinese: 国学大师陈寅恪先生晚年也是如此。

sentences.chinese: 钱伟长先生的四叔，就是国学大师钱穆。

sentences.english: But it was such a master that didn't know where he himself lived.
sentences.chinese: 就是这么一位国学大师，却糊涂到连自家门也不认得。

sentences.english: Chinese culture of Confucianism, Buddhism, Taoism three studies, the most follow xing) is not letter.

sentences.chinese: 这方面，国学大师陈寅恪是我们的典范。

sentences.chinese: 国学一定可以拥有更加光明的未来。

sentences.chinese: 第三章，振兴大学国学教育的必要性与可能性。

sentences.english: The first chapter traces the emergence of "Folklore Movement" to its incorporation into Chinese Studies.
sentences.chinese: 首章论述歌谣运动从发起征集到并入国学的基本脉络。

sentences.english: As the matter of fact, Cungu School is the highest institution of traditional Chinese culture in Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，存古成为当时四川培养国学人才的最高学府。

definition: the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
words of truth/moral expressed in words/written article explaining a moral
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
old learning/Chinese traditional teaching as opposed to material from the West
